docs.snippet: LEAD: N.H.L.  Capitals 1, Flyers 0: Kelly Miller scored 3 minutes 17 seconds into overtime to give Washington the victory over Philadelphia yesterday in Landover, Md. The victory moved Washington into second place in the Patrick Division, 4 points...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: N.H.L. Capitals 1, Flyers 0: Kelly Miller scored 3 minutes 17 seconds into overtime to give Washington the victory over Philadelphia yesterday in Landover, Md. The victory moved Washington into second place in the Patrick Division, 4 points behind the Flyers and 1 ahead of the third-place Islanders.(AP)

docs.snippet: LEAD: Raquel Boldorini, a pianist from Uruguay who has built a broad South American career and who toured in the United States twice in the 1970's, came to Weill Recital Hall on Monday evening for a concert of music from the first half of the 20th...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Raquel Boldorini, a pianist from Uruguay who has built a broad South American career and who toured in the United States twice in the 1970's, came to Weill Recital Hall on Monday evening for a concert of music from the first half of the 20th century.

docs.snippet: LEAD: Uruguay's Foreign Minister, Enrique Yglesias, is emerging as a leading candidate for the presidency of the Inter-American Development Bank, a 44-nation Washington institution that makes development loans to Latin American countries.

headline.main: America Is Running Out of Time

byline.original: By DANIEL A. SHARP; Daniel A. Sharp is president of the American Assembly. For the past 15 years he has worked for the Xerox Corporation primarily responsible for international relations

docs.snippet: LEAD: Uruguay's Foreign Minister, Enrique V. Iglesias, is expected to be elected president of the Inter-American Development Bank at a special meeting of its executive board Thursday, bank officials said today.
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Uruguay's Foreign Minister, Enrique V. Iglesias, is expected to be elected president of the Inter-American Development Bank at a special meeting of its executive board Thursday, bank officials said today.

headline.main: Uruguayan Expected To Lead Latin Aid Unit

byline.original: By CLYDE H. FARNSWORTH, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: Uruguay's Foreign Minister, Enrique V. Iglesias, who once headed one of the largest private banking groups in his country, was elected president of the Inter-American Development Bank today.
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Uruguay's Foreign Minister, Enrique V. Iglesias, who once headed one of the largest private banking groups in his country, was elected president of the Inter-American Development Bank today.

docs.snippet: LEAD: The Reagan Administration, estimating that American business is losing more than $60 billion a year from the piracy of patents and intellectual property, said today that it was pressing for an international mechanism to suppress the practice...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The Reagan Administration, estimating that American business is losing more than $60 billion a year from the piracy of patents and intellectual property, said today that it was pressing for an international mechanism to suppress the practice with economic deterrents.

headline.main: U.S. to Offer Proposals to Fight Piracy

byline.original: By CLYDE H. FARNSWORTH, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: Most Latin American Governments today condemned the move to dismiss Panama's civilian President in a confrontation with the military ruler.

headline.main: Most Latin Nations, Ending Reticence, Back Deposed Panamanian

docs.snippet: LEAD: Among the nearly three million Uruguayans the prevailing view is that an accident of birth is the only thing keeping Enrique Iglesias from being their next elected President.

docs.snippet: LEAD: A high-level United States trade mission clashed sharply with senior European officials today over the Reagan Administration's proposal to eliminate all subsidies from world agricultural trade by the year 2000, including those paid to American...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: A high-level United States trade mission clashed sharply with senior European officials today over the Reagan Administration's proposal to eliminate all subsidies from world agricultural trade by the year 2000, including those paid to American farmers.

headline.main: U.S. Assailed on Freer Farm Trade
